text: Food is not just eating energy. It's an experience.
author: Guy Fieri

text: Food is our common ground, a universal experience.
author: James Beard

text: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: All happiness depends on a leisurely breakfast.
author: John Gunther

text: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Food is symbolic of love when words are inadequate.
author: Alan D. Wolfelt

text: Eating good food is my favorite thing in the whole world. Nothing is more blissful.
author: Justine Larbalestier

text: A recipe has no soul, you as the cook must bring soul to the recipe.
author: Thomas Keller

text: First we eat, then we do everything else.
author: M.F.K. Fisher

text: Cooking and baking is both physical and mental therapy.
author: Mary Berry

text: Good food is good mood.
author: Unknown

text: Life is uncertain. Eat dessert first.
author: Ernestine Ulmer

text: All I want for Christmas is food.
author: Unknown

text: People who love to eat are always the best people.
author: Julia Child

text: You don't need a silver fork to eat good food.
author: Paul Prudhomme

text: Food is the ingredient that binds us together.
author: Unknown

text: Eating is a necessity, but cooking is an art.
author: Unknown

text: There is no sincere love than the love of food.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Food is our common ground, a universal experience.
author: James Beard

text: One of the very nicest things about life is the way we must regularly stop whatever it is we are doing and devote our attention to eating.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

text: The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook.
author: Julia Child

text: Food is not rational. Food is culture, habit, craving, and identity.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

text: The secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
author: Mark Twain

text: The belly rules the mind.
author: Spanish Proverb

text: A balanced diet is a cookie in each hand.
author: Barbara Johnson

text: I'm just someone who likes cooking and for whom sharing food is a form of expression.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Cooking is like love. It should be entered into with abandon or not at all.
author: Harriet Van Horne

text: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields

text: You are what you eat, so don't be fast, cheap, easy, or fake.
author: Unknown

text: Food is not just fuel, it's information. It talks to your DNA and tells it what to do.
author: Dr. Mark Hyman

text: The only thing I like better than talking about food is eating.
author: John Walters

text: I come from a family where gravy is considered a beverage.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: Food is a central activity of mankind and one of the single most significant trademarks of a culture.
author: Mark Kurlansky

text: Cooking is at once one of the simplest and most gratifying of the arts, but to cook well one must love and respect food.
author: Craig Claiborne

text: Food is not just eating energy, it's an experience.
author: Guy Fieri

text: I love pizza. I want to marry it, but it would just be to eat her family at the wedding.
author: Mike Birbiglia

text: You don't have to cook fancy or complicated masterpieces - just good food from fresh ingredients.
author: Julia Child

text: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

text: Good food and a warm kitchen are what makes a house a home.
author: Rachael Ray

text: Eating is so intimate. It's very sensual. When you invite someone to sit at your table and you want to cook for them, you're inviting a person into your life.
author: Maya Angelou

text: You are what you eat, so don't be fast, cheap, easy or fake.
author: Unknown

text: Food is like a legal drug. You can take 50 cents and walk into the store and buy a Twinkie and get high. And it's killing people.
author: Joel Salatin

text: The smell of good bread baking, like the sound of lightly flowing water, is indescribable in its evocation of innocence and delight.
author: M.F.K. Fisher

text: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: My weaknesses have always been food and men - in that order.
author: Dolly Parton

text: Food is not just fuel, it's information. It talks to your DNA and tells it what to do.
author: Dr. Mark Hyman

text: I love cooking for myself and cooking for my family.
author: Al Roker

text: People who love to eat are always the best people.
author: Julia Child

text: Food is an important part of a balanced diet.
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: I cook with wine. Sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields

text: I'm just someone who likes cooking and for whom sharing food is a form of expression.
author: Maya Angelou

text: You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

text: Cooking is about passion, so it may look slightly temperamental in a way that it's too assertive to the naked eye.
author: Gordon Ramsay

text: Good food is a global thing and I find that there is always something new and amazing to learn - I love it!
author: Jamie Oliver

text: The only thing I like better than talking about food is eating.
author: John Walters

text: If you're afraid of butter, use cream.
author: Julia Child

text: Food is a way of saying welcome and farewell to one's friends.
author: Yann Martel

text: First, we eat. Then we can do everything else.
author: M.F.K.
